org.apache.juneau.parser

Class ParserContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HtmlParserContext, JsonParserContext, MsgPackParserContext, RdfParserContext, UonParserContext, XmlParserContext

    public class ParserContext
extends Context
    Configurable properties common to all parsers.
    Configurable properties common to all parsers
    Setting nameDescriptionData typeDefault value
    PARSER_debug Debug mode. Boolean false
    PARSER_trimStrings Trim parsed strings. Boolean false
    Author:
    James Bognar (james.bognar@salesforce.com)

    • Field Detail

      • PARSER_debug

        public static final String PARSER_debug
        Configuration property: Debug mode.

        • Name: "Parser.debug"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false

        Enables the following additional information during parsing:

        • When bean setters throws exceptions, the exception includes the object stack information in order to determine how that method was invoked.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PARSER_trimStrings

        public static final String PARSER_trimStrings
        Configuration property: Trim parsed strings.

        • Name: "Parser.trimStrings"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false

        If true, string values will be trimmed of whitespace using String.trim() before being added to the POJO.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PARSER_strict

        public static final String PARSER_strict
        Configuration property: Strict mode.

        • Name: "Parser.strict"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false

        If true, strict mode for the parser is enabled.

        Strict mode can mean different things for different parsers. However, all reader-based parsers will

        Parser classStrict behavior
        All reader-based parsers When enabled, throws ParseExceptions on malformed charset input. Otherwise, malformed input is ignored.
        JsonParser When enabled, throws exceptions on the following invalid JSON syntax:
        • Unquoted attributes.
        • Missing attribute values.
        • Concatenated strings.
        • Javascript comments.
        • Numbers and booleans when Strings are expected.
        • Numbers valid in Java but not JSON (e.g. octal notation, etc...)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PARSER_inputStreamCharset

        public static final String PARSER_inputStreamCharset
        Configuration property: Input stream charset.

        • Name: "Parser.inputStreamCharset"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "UTF-8"

        The character set to use for converting InputStreams and byte arrays to readers.

        Used when passing in input streams and byte arrays to Parser.parse(Object, Class).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PARSER_fileCharset

        public static final String PARSER_fileCharset
        Configuration property: File charset.

        • Name: "Parser.fileCharset"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "default"

        The character set to use for reading Files from the file system.

        Used when passing in files to Parser.parse(Object, Class).

        "default" can be used to indicate the JVM default file system charset.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public ParserContext(ContextFactory cf)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        cf - The factory that created this context.
